newsitem.title: USA: Clark alkylation unit seen back this week.
newsitem.headline: Clark alkylation unit seen back this week.

text.p: Clark Refining and Marketing Co expects to return an alkylation unit at its Chicago-area refinery back to service on Wednesday following a fire that idled the unit over the weekend, traders said on Tuesday.
A fire on a propane line shut the 6,400 barrel per day (bpd) alkylation unit at Clark's 80,515 bpd Blue Island, Ill., refinery early Saturday. The unit produces premium unleaded gasoline.
A Clark spokeswoman was not available for comment.
The outage forced Clark into the spot market to buy unleaded gasoline barrels, and has fueled a modest upward move in Chicago gasoline differentials, traders said.
Illinois Attorney General Jim Ryan on Monday said he plans to seek a court order to temporarily shut down the refinery until it is proven safe.
Clark is a unit of Clark USA Inc which is 49 percent owned by The Horsham Corp of Canada.
